q1.question: Is it available for iOS and Android?
q1.answer: Yes, ETAXI is available on both App Store (iOS) and Google Play (Android). Download it for free on your preferred device.

q2.question: Is the app free to download?
q2.answer: Yes, the download is 100% free and there is no subscription cost. You only pay for the trips you take according to the official fare.

q3.question: What permissions does the app need?
q3.answer: The app needs access to your location to show nearby taxis and calculate routes. Optionally, you can allow notifications to receive updates about your trip. All permissions are configurable.

q4.question: Can I use ETAXI without registering?
q4.answer: To request a taxi you need to create an account. Registration is quick and only requires your phone number. We use OTP (SMS code) for better security, no passwords needed.

q5.question: How does payment work?
q5.answer: Payment is made directly to the driver at the end of the trip. You can pay in cash or with the methods the driver accepts. The fare is official and transparent.

q6.question: Can I cancel a trip?
q6.answer: Yes, you can cancel your request before the driver arrives. Check the cancellation policy in the app for more details.

q1.question: Is ETAXI available in my city?
q1.answer: ETAXI is available in Chile's main cities and we keep expanding. Download the app to see if there's coverage in your area. If not, we'll be there soon.

q2.question: How much does using ETAXI cost?
q2.answer: Downloading and registering is 100% free. You only pay the official trip fare, with no subscription cost or hidden charges. The fare is fixed and transparent.

q3.question: How is the fare calculated?
q3.answer: We use the official fare regulated by the Ministry of Transport. It's a fixed rate that doesn't change based on demand, peak hours or weather. Always transparent.

q4.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q4.answer: Currently payment is made directly to the driver at the end of the trip (cash or methods the driver accepts). We're working on integrating digital payments in the app.

q5.question: Can I request a taxi for someone else?
q5.answer: Yes, you can request a taxi for a family member or friend by entering the corresponding pickup address. Ideal for helping elderly people or sending taxis to others.

q6.question: What if I have a problem during the trip?
q6.answer: You have several options: use the panic button for emergencies, contact 24/7 support from the app, or report the problem after the trip. All complaints are investigated.

q7.question: Can I cancel a requested trip?
q7.answer: Yes, you can cancel before the driver arrives. The app will show you the cancellation conditions. We ask you to do so only when necessary to not affect drivers.

q8.question: How do I know the driver is trustworthy?
q8.answer: All our drivers undergo background checks, have a valid professional A1 license and are legally registered. Additionally, each driver has a visible rating.

regulations.title: Regulatory Framework in Which ETAXI Operates
regulations.subtitle: ETAXI aligns with Chile's transportation regulatory framework to help companies and unions operate within the law.

law21553.title: Law 21.553 — Transportation Application Companies (EAT)
law21553.description: This law establishes the legal framework for technology platforms that intermediate remunerated passenger transportation services.
law21553.bullet1: Requires platforms to work only with vehicles duly authorized by the Ministry of Transport
law21553.bullet2: Establishes obligations for traceability, trip records, and fare transparency
law21553.bullet3: Protects both passengers and drivers with safety standards and mandatory insurance

ds212.title: Supreme Decree 212 — Taxis and Regulated Services
ds212.description: Regulation governing the operation of collective taxis, radio taxis, and remunerated passenger transport services.
ds212.bullet1: Defines vehicle licensing requirements (municipal permits, technical inspection, insurance)
ds212.bullet2: Establishes that only authorized drivers can operate regulated taxis
ds212.bullet3: Requires fares approved by competent authority and operational activity records

role.title: ETAXI's Role within this Framework
role.subtitle: ETAXI is a technology provider, not a transport operator. We clarify what we do and what we don't do.

does.title: ETAXI Does:
does.item1: Provides the technology platform for trip assignment and fleet management
does.item2: Facilitates complete trip traceability (origin, destination, driver, time)
does.item3: Enables operational control and report generation for companies and unions
does.item4: Offers tools to validate that only authorized drivers and vehicles operate

doesnt.title: ETAXI Doesn't:
doesnt.item1: Doesn't operate transport or employ drivers
doesnt.item2: Doesn't contract or pay drivers directly (that's the operator's responsibility)
doesnt.item3: Doesn't set fares as operator (fares are configured by the authorized operator)
doesnt.item4: Doesn't issue invoices for trips (that's done by the transport operator)

risks.title: Risks of Operating with Unregulated Apps
risks.subtitle: Using platforms that don't align with Chilean regulations can expose companies and unions to legal, operational, and reputational problems.
risks.risk1: Risk of fines for using transport services not compliant with regulations (Law 21.553 and DS 212)
risks.risk2: Difficulty backing insurance claims in case of accident if service isn't properly authorized
risks.risk3: Disorder in labor responsibilities: confusion about who is the employer and who manages the relationship with drivers
risks.risk4: Corporate reputation impact: operating with informal services can affect image before stakeholders, clients, and authorities

counterpoint.title: ETAXI is designed to provide order, traceability, and documentary support
counterpoint.description: By working exclusively with regulated taxis and aligning with Chilean regulations, ETAXI helps companies and unions reduce legal risk, have greater operational control, and maintain auditable traceability of all trips.
